In the event you need to tear down your elasticsearch index, there is a web API that you can take advantage of to make this fairly straight forward:

bash curl http://localhost:9200/_mapping > {"app_name":{"resource": {"123": "some-value"}}}

Making a GET request like the one above, where localhost:9200 is the web interface of your elasticsearch server, will return a mapping of all the indexes currently available on the server. To delete a specific mapping, simply send a DELETE request to the server with the path to the index tacked on to the URL. eg.

bash curl -XDELETE http://localhost:9200/app_name/resource/123

or to delete a parent index and associated child indexes:

bash curl -XDELETE http://localhost:9200/app_name
